intro: Briggsia hians, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow ray flowers that resemble a crown. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves and produces small, inconspicuous disk flowers at the center of the inflorescence. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Briggsia hians is valued for its ornamental appeal and is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
